availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Tyler Barry South (Franklin County, Kentucky, captain (CSA))

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, soldier. Breathitt County, Kentucky, native. Son of Jerry Weldon South and Kitty Cockerell South. Married to Ann Mary Jones South. Student in Hardin County in 1850. Resident of Franklin County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 5th Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a corporal, first lieutenant, and captain from December 31, 1861, to October 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Southern District, p. 44B.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Forks of Elkhorn, p. 81B.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0113.
